docs.snippet: Brexit worries are set to dominate the coming week, with Bank of England Governor Mark Carney stepping into the policy breach once more as Britain begins a two-month wait to find out the identity of its next Prime Minister....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brexit worries are set to dominate the coming week, with Bank of England Governor Mark Carney stepping into the policy breach once more as Britain begins a two-month wait to find out the identity of its next Prime Minister.

headline.main: Carney Steps Into the Brexit Breach Again

docs.snippet: Two weeks after Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union, the already bleak outlook for corporate profits in the region has darkened, with near-term concerns focussed on the health of banks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two weeks after Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union, the already bleak outlook for corporate profits in the region has darkened, with near-term concerns focussed on the health of banks.

docs.snippet: Mr. Farage, the politician who probably did more than any other to force the referendum on British membership in the European Union, resigned on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Farage, the politician who probably did more than any other to force the referendum on British membership in the European Union, resigned on Monday.
docs.abstract: Nigel Farage, British politician who spent nearly 20 years pushing for Great Britain to leave European Union, resigns as leader of right-wing populist UK Independence Party.

headline.main: Nigel Farage, Who Spurred ‘Brexit,’ Resigns as Head of U.K. Independence Party
headline.print_headline: Having Succeeded, Head of Party That Pushed Britain to Leave E.U. Resigns

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and STEVEN ERLANGER

docs.snippet: At the heart of the campaign that led Britain to vote to leave the European Union was a desire to regain independence lost amid a globalized world. It's the same kind of feeling that Donald Trump rode to become the presumptive Republican nominee i...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the heart of the campaign that led Britain to vote to leave the European Union was a desire to regain independence lost amid a globalized world. It's the same kind of feeling that Donald Trump rode to become the presumptive Republican nominee in the U.S., where he campaigns to put "America first" and "make America great again."

headline.main: Similar Frustrations for Trump and Brexit Voters
headline.print_headline: Similar Frustrations for Trump and Brexit Voters

docs.snippet: An altered power dynamic must be addressed as well as the question of whether to make fundamental changes or push ahead with deeper integration....
docs.lead_paragraph: An altered power dynamic must be addressed as well as the question of whether to make fundamental changes or push ahead with deeper integration.
docs.abstract: European Union leaders scheduled to meet following Britain's exit from bloc will face number of pressing questions on how best to respond to upheaval and changing power dynamics among bloc's largest members.

headline.main: Tough Choices and Hard Lessons for E.U. After ‘Brexit’ Vote
headline.print_headline: Tough Decisions and Hard Lessons as E.U. Leaders Prepare to Meet

byline.contributor: Alison Smale and Jim Yardley reported from London, and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris. James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE, JIM YARDLEY and ALISSA J. RUBIN

docs.snippet: Ecuadorean President Rafael Correa said on Saturday that Britain's vote to leave the European Union has "spoiled" a bond issue that had been planned for next week to help shore up the cash-strapped oil-exporter's finances....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ecuadorean President Rafael Correa said on Saturday that Britain's vote to leave the European Union has "spoiled" a bond issue that had been planned for next week to help shore up the cash-strapped oil-exporter's finances.

docs.snippet: It would be beneficial for Ireland if neighbouring Britain held its referendum on European Union membership as soon as June so Ireland could prepare for any adverse impact on its economy, its new central bank governor said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: It would be beneficial for Ireland if neighbouring Britain held its referendum on European Union membership as soon as June so Ireland could prepare for any adverse impact on its economy, its new central bank governor said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Irish Central Bank Favours Early 'Brexit' Vote
headline.print_headline: Irish Central Bank Favours Early 'Brexit' Vote
